availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: James H. Drane (Shelby County, Kentucky, farmer and postmaster)

body.p: Shelby County, Kentucky, farmer and postmaster. Kentucky native. Married to Nancy Wells Drane in Shelby County on November 2, 1825. Father of William C. Drane. Appointed postmaster of Bayard in Shelby County from March 5, 1838, to June 20, 1850. Farmer in Shelby County in 1860. Owned eighteen enslaved persons in Shelby County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Shelby County, District 1, p. 198.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Shelby County, District 1, p. 18.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Shelby County Marriages, Film #000259284, p. 147 of 791 of microfilm.
Record of Appointment of Postmasters, 1832-1971, NARA Microfilm Publication, M841, Records of the Post Office Department, Record Group Number 28, p. 434 (accessed via Ancestry.com).
Record of Appointment of Postmasters, 1832-1971. Records of the Post Office Department, NARA Series M841, RG 28, Shelby County, Kentucky, Volume 14, p. 720, p. 229 of 557 of microfilm (accessed via Ancestry.com).
Find A Grave, "James H. Drane (March 31, 1805-October 23, 1892)," Memorial #8207894, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/8207894 (accessed August 2, 2018).
